note.p: Birth: St Andre d'Hebertot, Normandy, France (16 May 1763)
Death: St Andre d'Hebertot, Normandy, France (14 or 15 November 1829)

Career: Laboratory boy, Rouen (1771-1779); assistant to A F Fourcroy (1783-1791); discovered chromium (1797), berryllium (1798) and a number of organic compounds; apothecary, military hospital, Melun; Extraordinary Professor of Chemistry, Ecole Polytechnique; Professor, College de France; Professor of Chemistry, Jardin des Plantes and in the Faculty of Medicine, Paris; retired (1822)
Memberships: Royal Academy of Sciences at Paris
References: N G Coley, 'George Pearson MD, FRS (1751-1828): 'The greatest chemist in England'? in NR 2003 vol 57 pp
